title: EVs to jump to 5m in SSEN distribution area as country moves to net zero
lead: ​Across the north of Scotland and central southern England alone, the number of electric vehicles (EV) is likely to increase to over 5 million by 2050.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ROUND-UP: The best energy and EV technology on display at CES
lead: A round-up of some of the energy and EV technologies and companies highlighted at CES 2021.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Igloo Energy becomes latest company to join Electric Nation project
lead: ​Energy supplier Igloo Energy has become the latest company to join Western Power Distribution’s (WPD) vehicle-to-grid (V2G) trial Electric Nation.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Energy bodies call for greater consumer protection as DSR sector grows
lead: ​As the domestic demand side response (DSR) sector grows, it will be essential that consumers are protected.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UKPNS begins work at Port of Tyne to aid its transition to all-electric
lead: ​UK Power Networks Services (UKPNS) is to undertake detailed modelling and analysis of the Port of Tyne’s electricity network to enable it electrify.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Centrica hit by 15% drop in electricity demand among UK business customers
lead: British Gas owner Centrica said electricity demand among its UK business customers was down by around 15% in the second half of 2020.
author: Jules Scully

title: Fossil fuel generation falls to record low as renewables dominate energy market
lead: Fossil fuel generation has more than halved over the last decade, hitting a new record low in 2020.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: McKinsey: Power consumption to double by 2050 as COVID-19 helps pull back fossil fuel peak
lead: Power consumption is set to more than double by 2050 as electrification increases, according to new research from McKinsey.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Sixth EMN issued while day ahead prices jump to £1,500/MWh as capacity remains tight
lead: ​The volatility in the energy market has continued this week, with National Grid ESO issuing another Electricity Market Notice (EMN) while day ahead prices just to almost £1,500/MWh.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UKPN partners local councils in bid to identify and incentivise priority EV chargepoint deployment
lead: ​UK Power Networks (UKPN) is launching a new initiative which sees local councils share data to help target electric vehicle (EV) charger blackspots.
author: Alice Grundy

title: WPD launches latest flexibility tender calling for 238MW
lead: ​Western Power Distribution (WPD) has launched its latest flexibility procurement auction, with a call for 238.83MW across 38 locations.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Boosting battery storage capacity by 20GWh could cut wind curtailment by 50%
lead: ​An increase of 20GWh of battery storage could reduce the amount of wasted wind power in Great Britain by 50%, according to new analysis from LCP.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Elexon unveils 2021/22 priorities with new Kinnect platform centre stage
lead: ​Elexon has outlined its priorities for 2021/22 in its draft business plan for the year, with its new platform Kinnect at the forefront of its activities.
author: Alice Grundy

title: 2020 hailed as greenest year ever by National Grid ESO with wind, solar and coal-free records
lead: ​2020 was a record-breaking year, with wind generation, solar, and coal-free records helping to make it the greenest year ever for Great Britain’s electricity network.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Hitachi hands £10m boost to GRIDSERVE as duo strengthen partnership
lead: ​Hitachi Capital UK has made another investment into GRIDSERVE, cementing the partnership between the two.
author: Alice Grundy

title: PODCAST: What’s driving solar and energy storage in 2021?
lead: The Solar Media Podcast returns for its first episode of the new year, with Liam Stoker and Andy Colthorpe discussing what’s on the immediate horizon for the solar and storage sectors.
author: Current± Staff

title: Smart Power Systems celebrates first evGRID installation as part of Newcastle V2G trial
lead: Smart Power Systems (SPS) has installed its first evGRID product to manage electric vehicle (EV) charging as part of the Smart Hubs vehicle-to-grid (V2G) project at Newcastle University​.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Balancing Mechanism price jumps to highest level since 2001, hitting £4,000/MWh
lead: ​The imbalance price reached a high of £4,000/MWh on Friday evening, capping off a dramatic week in the energy market.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: OVO Group posts £106m loss in 2019, sees revenue from smart meter installations decline
lead: OVO Group has said its 2019 results are “in line” with its financial plan despite recording a loss of £106 million for the year.
author: Jules Scully

title: Kwarteng takes BEIS top spot in mini-reshuffle that prioritises COP26
lead: ​Kwasi Kwarteng has been appointed Secretary of State for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) in a mini-shuffle.
author: Molly Lempriere
